author: Justin Potts
comment: If I accidently set auto mode it won't let me return to manual until I stop the app and restart it (which is a pain since it turns brightness to the max and Hwatch has no light sensor). Also, ambient mode does not match the controlled brightness (at least not when turned down low). Other than those two things I like it a lot! I think I'll keep it since it appears the dev cares about the app and might make it better :-)

Had to change my review from 4 stars to 5 after an update fixed my issue with the app not working sometimes. The dev even replied to let me know the update would fix the issue.  Probably my most used AW app I'd say

reply.author: Sve
reply.content: I pushed a new version, there was a problem in the previous one. Please let me know if still not working as expected. Thank you!

title: Essential for Android wear

author: Amy Christian
comment: When this works it does work fantastic. I am having the same problem as the other reviewers. I can turn the brightness down below factory allowance, which is why I was looking for an app. The reason I picked this one is that it works on any screen. I tend to like the brightness down very low in dim environments, I've had trouble in the past leaving the brightness on my phone too low and going out in the morning and can't see enough to turn the brightness back up. When using this app I'm not sure if I'm accidentally turning on auto mode as the previous commenter mentioned, but each time I want to use it I have to turn it off and back on again to get it functioning. If that problem is resolved I would give the app 4 stars... 5 if it could control the ambient screen!

author: Wissam M. Khoury
comment: Rarely works or too complicated with no guidelines how to make it work.
title: Nice idea bad implementation

comment: Doesn't work on my LG GWR running Wear 2.0
Very useful, however I can't control the brightness using the right side of the screen on my Huawei watch.

comment: Doesn't work on LG G Watch R
Such a useful and necessary tool that should have been included in the stock OS. Thank you so much for this. Your app is a godsend! Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

comment: I've been using wear launchers for a long time and mainly use it for screen brightness. Those just kill my battery. Found this gem and I couldn't be happier. Work's perfect and no issues or insane battery drain.

reply.author: Sve
reply.content: Ah, so good to hear that! Thank you!

title: Exactly what I was looking for!

author: Ben Edwards
comment: This is a fantastic app that easily allows you to control the brightness on wear that don't have ambient light sensors. This functionality should really be on all Android Wear as standard, well done!

reply.author: Sve
reply.content: Thank you for the nice review! I did it for myself, but I'm glad is helping others too!

author: Steven Roberts
comment: Since wear devices are missing some features I'd think would ship standard, this tool is a must have. Set the adjust location where it won't interfere with other touch functions and you have a super quick brightness adjustment on the fly. Thanks for sharing!

title: Lg urbane 2

author: Atte Lehtinen
comment: Installed on my Urbane but didn't notice any effect.

reply.author: Sve
reply.content: Hi, did you see that the app was installed on the watch or msg "Brightness Control is ON"? If you missed some of this notifications you can try to use the phone app to switch it on/off or change the sliding areas. The best way to check if it's working is by tapping at the corners and see if the percentages will show on the screen.Appreciate!Thanks!

author: Chris Twiner
comment: If you configure the right side of the watch only the left side still affects the brightness. This means it doesn't work well with launchers that run on the left side of the watch screen. Round watches can't use the corners either Without a launcher this wouldn't be an issue perhaps. This fixed would be a clear 5 though as the interface, when enabled, is perfect.

reply.content:
Hi! Can you give me the resolution of your watch?
I wanna check if the right bar is not hidden some how.
Thank you!
